alfredsnippet.snippet:
Quasars, Redshifts & Controversies, Halton Arp, p.178

"It would seem obvious that if a scientist only reasons deductively from known laws then he or she can never do more than recover those laws, and will never discover anything fundamentally new."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Arp on Deductive Reasoning
